intro: Aphoma cuneata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed aphoma, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and features narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its small, yellowish flowers bloom in the summer, attracting various pollinators. Aphoma cuneata is often found in sandy or loamy soils and prefers partial to full shade.
